intro: Asclepiodora insignis, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its milky sap, which contains toxic compounds. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves and produces showy, yellow-orange flowers with five petals. It thrives in well-drained soil and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Asclepiodora insignis is also noted for its role in supporting local insect populations, including certain species of butterflies.
